intro: Tephrosia marginata var. cinerascens, commonly known as the gray tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant features compound leaves with alternating leaflets and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their antifungal and insecticidal properties. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
